description: Prove the famous Basel Problem: the sum of 1/n² from n=1 to infinity equals π²/6. Start with title 'The Basel Problem'. Show the series written as '1/1² + 1/2² + 1/3² + ...' using superscript ² characters. Visualize each term as colored bars on a number line. Display running sum at bottom: 'Sum: 1.0', 'Sum: 1.25', etc. Show partial sums approaching π²/6 ≈ 1.6449. End with final centered yellow equation: '∑1/n² = π²/6'. Keep all text centered, nothing on right edge.
